001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
007
008/**
009 * Defines an optimization algorithm for training an {@link EstimationFunction}.
010 *
011 * <p>
012 * An {@code Optimizer} updates the parameters of an estimation function
013 * (e.g., a machine learning model) to minimize an {@link ObjectiveFunction}
014 * when applied to a given {@link DataSet}.
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * Different optimizers implement different update rules (e.g., gradient descent,
019 * stochastic gradient descent, Adam). This interface abstracts those details
020 * to allow interchangeable use of optimizers in training regimes.
021 * </p>
022 *
023 * @param <E> the type of estimation function being optimized
024 * @see EstimationFunction
025 * @see ObjectiveFunction
026 * @see DataSet
027 */
028@DomainObject
029@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
030public interface Optimizer<E extends EstimationFunction> {
031
032    /**
033     * An {@link Optimizer} variant that is restricted to online (sample-by-sample)
034     * optimization.
035     *
036     * <p>
037     * Implementations of {@code OnlineOnly} optimize the estimation function one
038     * sample at a time rather than processing the entire dataset in a batch.
039     * This is common in streaming or online learning contexts.
040     * </p>
041     *
042     * <p>
043     * The default {@link #optimize(EstimationFunction, DataSet, ObjectiveFunction)}
044     * implementation iterates through the dataset and delegates to
045     * {@link #optimize(EstimationFunction, DataSet.Sample, ObjectiveFunction)} for
046     * each sample.
047     * </p>
048     *
049     * @param <E> the type of estimation function being optimized
050     */
051    @Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
052    interface OnlineOnly<E extends EstimationFunction> extends Optimizer<E> {
053
054        /**
055         * Default implementation of batch optimization for {@code OnlineOnly}
056         * optimizers. Iterates over the dataset and delegates optimization to
057         * the per-sample method.
058         *
059         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
060         * @param trainingSet        the dataset used for optimization
061         * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
062         *                           and gradients
063         */
064        @Override
065        default void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective) {
066            trainingSet.forEach(s -> optimize(estimationFunction, s, objective));
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Optimizes the given estimation function using a single sample
071         * and the specified objective function.
072         *
073         * <p>
074         * Implementations typically calculate the gradient of the loss function
075         * for the given sample and update the parameters of the estimation function
076         * immediately, enabling online or stochastic optimization.
077         * </p>
078         *
079         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
080         * @param sample             the training sample used for optimization
081         * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
082         *                           and gradients
083         */
084        void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet.Sample sample, ObjectiveFunction objective);
085
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * Optimizes the given estimation function based on the entire training set
090     * and the specified objective function.
091     *
092     * <p>
093     * Typical implementations evaluate the {@link ObjectiveFunction} across the
094     * training set, compute gradients, and update the parameters of the
095     * estimation function accordingly.
096     * </p>
097     *
098     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to optimize
099     * @param trainingSet        the dataset used for optimization
100     * @param objective          the objective function that defines the loss
101     *                           and gradients
102     */
103    void optimize(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective);
104
105}
